#Text=Start Your Own Private Lesson Business
#Text=Have you ever wondered how to make a profit from a private lesson business ?
#Text=If you have expertise in almost any area , there is a good chance someone else will want to learn from you .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Decide what skill or area of expertise you wish to market .
#Text=The private lesson business is most certainly not limited to teaching just a few subjects .
#Text=There are hundreds of different skills which may be marketed for private lessons .
#Text=Whether you know how to perform martial arts , cook gourmet meals , embroidery , day trade , understand currency exchange , or know yoga , someone else is bound to want to learn from you .
#Text=One teacher started her private lesson business by offering lessons in the Japanese language , while a musician used his skills and talents to teach private music lessons .
#Text=Focus on some talent or skill you enjoy .
#Text=If you are passionate about the subject you teach , you will enjoy giving private lessons and your enthusiasm will inspire your students .
#Text=Do your " Homework " .
#Text=Research the market to determine what competition you will encounter .
#Text=What does your competitor charge ?
#Text=Make a " Lesson Plan " .

column1: #Text=Decide how you will do business .

#Text=Knowing who will be doing the teaching , where lessons will be taught , the types of payments you will accept , what your bookkeeping or accounting needs look like , and what your licensing and liability insurance needs will be , are some important items to address before opening the doors to your students .
#Text=" Ring the Bell " .
#Text=Devise a marketing strategy to get students into your classes , ( space ads , direct mail , promotions , online presence , and word of mouth ) , and set your marketing budget .
#Text=Consider using flyers or offering free seminars to groups where you might encounter prospective students .
#Text=This can be very helpful if you have a small marketing budget .
#Text=Space ads , a webpage , direct mail , special promotions and word-of-mouth advertising can also bring your new business to the attention of prospective students .
#Text=" Class is in Session " .
#Text=Having a successful private lesson business can be rewarding and fulfilling .

#Text=Deciding on the type of lessons you want to teach , doing your homework and market research , making a lesson plan that will be your guide through the everyday details of your business , and finally , marketing yourself to prospective students , may seem like a lot of work to do before you ever begin teaching , but once you have mastered the basics , you can relax and enjoy sharing your knowledge and , even better , get paid for it !
#Text=Tips
#Text=Obtain the proper licenses and certifications required for operating a business in your area .
#Text=Become certified or accredited by organizations that specialize in your service .
#Text=For instance , if you offer scuba lessons , become certified in your profession , and offer the classes and training for others to become certified scuba divers or instructors .
#Text=Contact the Small Business Personal Banker at your local bank to obtain a credit card machine or credit forms for your student 's payments .

#Text=It may cost a little upfront to take credit cards , but by offering the option , you may find your students will also be more inclined to purchase back end merchandise from you , ( for example : music books , cook books or specialty utensils , language tapes , etc. ) or even extend their lessons beyond the basics .
#Text=Also consider accepting Pay Pal as an alternative payment method .
#Text=Offer " Grand Opening " discounts .
#Text=By initially charging less than your competitors , you may grab some of the market share .
#Text=Consider discounting lesson prices or services at first , if you are in direct competition with other private lesson providers .
#Text=After you have adequate clientele , you can always increase your charges to the current market prices .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Never place your students in danger without their knowledge and signed consent and waiver releasing you from responsibility for accidents .
#Text=This applies even if they say they cannot sign that waiver for whatever reason .
#Text=Always explain the possible risks associated in learning a new skill , and do all you can do to alleviate the chances of an accidental injury or death .
